posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
So I’ve imaged our limelight with the new version of photonvision using balena etcher but I’m not able to connect to the https://photonvision.local url.

The limelight is plugged into the pdp on a 20A breaker and the ethernet cable is plugged into the secondary port on the robot’s radio.

What am I doing wrong? Thanks!!
This is a known issue that we’re working to fix right now. A known workaround is using a network switch.

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: Don’t use the secondary port of the radio. It is known to be effectively nonfunctional. You need a network switch.
100% use a network switch. I highly recommend BrainBox

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Amazon.com: RJ45 Ethernet Splitter Cable, Sartyee RJ45 Y Splitter Adapter 1 to 3 Port Ethernet Switch Adapter Cable for CAT 5/CAT 6 LAN Ethernet Socket Connector Adapter Cat5 Cat6 Cable - ONE at A TIME : Electronics

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Based on the link, I would say it would not work. It’s not a switch.

posts.name: Ari Meles-Braverman
posts.cooked:
From the Amazon page

This won’t work assuming you want to use all three ports at once. You want a “network switch” or “ethernet switch” which will allow you to use all of the ports at once. I’ll second the recommendation for the Brainboxes switches, specifically SW-005 or SW-008.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.custom_user_title: FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked: Nope, that is a Hub, not a Switch.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Use an ethernet switch. There are many known issues with using the two ports on the radio (long story short, there’s a silicon-level bug that causes the coupling of the two ethernet ports to be unreliable). Many teams have had success with the Brainboxes SW-005 switch - it can be powered off one of the low-current channels on your PDH, and is easily mountable. You can use your team’s Digi-Key voucher from the virtual Kit of Parts on it.

link_counts.title: Why you probably shouldn't use the second port on your OpenMesh OM5P Radio and embrace using an Ethernet Switch instead

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: I found a 5 port Netgear switch kicking around. Would that work?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Yes, if it’s powered by 12 or 18 volt “passive” PoE or with a 12 or 5 volt barrel jack. It should say on the label what it takes. It also can’t output “standard” or “active” PoE because that’s too high a voltage. R203.i limits all circuitry used on the robot to a maximum 24 volts, and standard PoE is about 44 volts.

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: He ac adapter says it takes 12 v at 0.7A. can I power that off the vrm?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Yes, on the 12V 2A channels. However, if you’re using a PoE injector for the radio, they can’t be on the same VRM - the radio needs to be the only thing on the 12V 2A channels of its VRM.

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Is that a rule or is it a safety concern?

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
It’s a rule, specifically R616, which reads:

R616 *Power radio as specified – Part 1. The wireless bridge (radio) power must be supplied by either: A. the 12V 2A output of a CTR Electronics Voltage Regulator Module ( VRM ) (P/N am-2857, 217-4245), as shown in Figure 9-13, and must be the only load connected to those terminals …

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Ok so I have the network switch wired up to the radio, roborio, and limelight but I still can’t connect to photonvision.local. I have verified that I have comms and can drive but the limelight still isn’t connecting. All the webpage says is that it refused to connect.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Are you typing photonvision.local:5800 ?

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Yes. When I wire my computer directly into the network switch, the page says photonvision sent an invalid response
